author: Staff Reporter
text:
creating awareness:People taking part in a signature campaign on the premises of Christian Medical College on Wednesday.- Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

It was a campaign to ensure 100 per cent polling in the May 16 Assembly elections.

On Wednesday, Collector R. Nanthagopal kick-started a signature campaign on the premises of Christian Medical College, Vellore. Several persons signed up to show their support to ensure 100 per cent voting.

The Collector, who is also the District Election Officer, distributed pamphlets to the public to create awareness on voting.

He later participated in an awareness programme at a polytechnic institute in Gudiyatham and administered a pledge to students, especially first time voters, to exercise their franchise.

31 lakh voters

He said Vellore district has around 31 lakh voters.

There are 85,000 new voters, while another 40,000 people have submitted applications to include them in the electoral list.

Hence, a total of 1.25 lakh young persons will be casting their votes in the May 16 Assembly polls, he said.

Among families, friends

He urged the students to create awareness among their families, friends and neighbours on the need to exercise the democratic right, a press release said.
title: Signature campaign to ensure 100 per cent voting in Vellore
